name: Memories of Midnight
description: The temporal anomaly crisis has created an unexpected problem: having so many individuals from various eras and timelines is blurring the history of the present. Bring the past of this timeline into sharper focus before the galaxy loses its identity.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of J. Archer, Taurik, or Seven will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: J. Archer, Taurik, or Seven
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Barrows
featured_crew.flavor: During her time with McCoy on shore leave, Barrows thinks of wearing a fairy-tale princess dress which somehow instantly materializes.

action.name: A Princess of the Blood Royale

featured_crew.name: Taurik
featured_crew.flavor: A witty and inquisitive Vulcan who befriended several ensigns. He was enthusiastic about his work with La Forge on the warp drive.

featured_crew.name: Seven
featured_crew.flavor: When Annika Hansen was assimilated with her family, she became the Borg drone Seven of Nine.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Seven
rewards.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine--now called Seven--struggled to adapt.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Barrows
rewards.flavor: During her time with McCoy on shore leave, Barrows thinks of wearing a fairy-tale princess dress which somehow instantly materializes.

rewards.name: Seven
rewards.flavor: When Annika Hansen was assimilated with her family, she became the Borg drone Seven of Nine.

rewards.name: Taurik
rewards.flavor: A witty and inquisitive Vulcan who befriended several ensigns. He was enthusiastic about his work with La Forge on the warp drive.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Utilize the meticulous records of the Dominion.
Access the knowledge of the Collective with the Borg.

screens.text: "Hey, Captain, thanks for answering my hails. To be honest, it feels like I'm a little in over my head here. Trying to remember things is hard enough, but things in this time period are all jumbled. It's hard to get a real sense of what's going on."

"It is ironic that the very temporal anomalies which brought you here have also brought so many others from alternate timelines, that the history of this timeline itself is becoming diluted in the minds of the people. It is natural you are struggling to make sense of it all."
"Perhaps it would be best to begin with physical artifacts. They are concrete, unchanging. Their fixed nature may in turn allow you to gain a grasp on the present situation."

"Hey, Captain, thanks for answering my hails. To be honest, it feels like I'm a little in over my head here. Trying to remember things is hard enough, but things in this time period are all jumbled. It's hard to get a real sense of what's going on."

"It is ironic that the very temporal anomalies which brought you here have also brought so many others from alternate timelines, that the history of this timeline itself is becoming diluted in the minds of the people. It is natural you are struggling to make sense of it all."
"Perhaps it would be best to begin with physical artifacts. They are concrete, unchanging. Their fixed nature may in turn allow you to gain a grasp on the present situation."
"Impressive work, Captain. Your ability to round up so many rare artifacts would put any Ferengi to shame."

"The Captain may fit in well among them. I however believe the Dominion to be best equipped to help us align the facts of the present. Their attention to detail is adequate to overcome the phenomenom of historical fact being tinged by those who emerge from conflict victorious."
"I disagree. The Collective has journeyed far and wide, assimilating a variety of species and thus access to their historic knowledge. Therefore, the Collective is best suited to this task."

responses.text: "How can we trust the Ferengi to give us genuine information?"
"The Dominion is meticulous, but they prioritize their own, right?"
"How can we be sure the Borg haven't assimilated individuals from other timelines?"

screens.text: "I remember the Ferengi, but the Dominion? The Borg? It's a lot to try and process. What are your thoughts, Captain?"
"I admit I'm skeptical too. Maybe I'm just relying on the devil I know here. But I'd like to think that trading in lies can't be good for business."
"The Founders dispatched the Changelings to learn about what they call 'Solids'. That curiosity leads me to believe they must have learned quite a lot about us."
"You think so little of the Collective that you do not believe we would know our own makeup?"
"At any rate, I trust your decision, Captain and I'd appreciate whatever you can pull together. It'd be nice to have a firm sense of where we've been to guide the way forward."
"Impressive work, Captain. Your ability to round up so many rare artifacts would put any Ferengi to shame."

"The Captain may fit in well among them. I however believe the Dominion to be best equipped to help us align the facts of the present. Their attention to detail is adequate to overcome the phenomenom of historical fact being tinged by those who emerge from conflict victorious."
"I disagree. The Collective has journeyed far and wide, assimilating a variety of species and thus access to their historic knowledge. Therefore, the Collective is best suited to this task."

responses.text: "How can we trust the Ferengi to give us genuine information?"
"The Dominion is meticulous, but they prioritize their own, right?"
"How can we be sure the Borg haven't assimilated individuals from other timelines?"

screens.text: "I remember the Ferengi, but the Dominion? The Borg? It's a lot to try and process. What are your thoughts, Captain?"
"I admit I'm skeptical too. Maybe I'm just relying on the devil I know here. But I'd like to think that trading in lies can't be good for business."
"The Founders dispatched the Changelings to learn about what they call 'Solids'. That curiosity leads me to believe they must have learned quite a lot about us."
"You think so little of the Collective that you do not believe we would know our own makeup?"
"At any rate, I trust your decision, Captain and I'd appreciate whatever you can pull together. It'd be nice to have a firm sense of where we've been to guide the way forward."
